thread.title: New Walking Tours Explore Nashville’s Food Scene
thread.title_full: New Walking Tours Explore Nashville’s Food Scene - The New York Times

author: Ashley Winchester
title: New Walking Tours Explore Nashville’s Food Scene
text:
Nashville is famous for its country music. But its food scene is hopping, too. The company Walk Eat Nashville offers tours of the city, with a new expansion exploring the restaurants and artisan food shops in the Midtown/Vanderbilt area, near Music Row, of Nashville. The neighborhood is known as the place where the city’s culinary roots took hold, and includes upscale dining and down-home cooking, said Karen-Lee Ryan, the Walk Eat Nashville founder. Tastings at each location include discussions with chefs, owners and managers. “I want people to connect to the food and the people who make it possible,” she said.
